get.description: List all support exchanges by this server

404.description: Exchange with that name is NOT supported

get.description: Retreives the current exchange connection details given the {exchangeName} and access token in the header

404.description: Exchange with that name is NOT supported

503.description: Support for exchange is currently broken

post.description: Creates a private connection to the exchange referenced in {exchangeName}

404.description: Exchange with that name is NOT supported

delete.description: Delete the exchange connection referenced by access token in the header

400.description: If the exchange itself complained about the parameters passed

401.description: If the exchange integration requires api key and secret for this function

403.description: If the exchange integration had an authentication issue (most probably nonce error)

404.description: Exchange with that name is NOT supported

501.description: If the exchange integration does NOT support this function

504.description: If the exchange itself could not be reached because of some network error

get.description:
Get the markets of the exchange referenced by the {exchangeName}.
*Parameters listed here are common to all exchanges. But any other parameter passed would be forwarded as well into the exchange.*

parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Any exchange specific parameters you want to pass in

Cancel an open order on the exchange referenced by the {exchangeName} and {orderId}.
*Parameters listed here are common to all exchanges. But any other parameter passed would be forwarded as well into the exchange.*

price.description: The price being asked for. If this is a bid, then this is the amount the bidder is willing to buy. If this is a sell, then this is the amount the seller is willing to sell for.

amount.description: The amount of units being sold.

currency.description: The currency at which this balance refers to

free.description: The amount of currency that is free to used

used.description: The amount of currency that is currently used

total.description: The total amount of currency (free + used)

id.description: The unique identifier for this market

symbol.description: A unified way of referencing this Market. When a symbol parameter is needed in one of the APIs, this iis where you will get it.

base.description: The base currency. Given 'BTC/USD', the base is 'BTC'

quote.description: The quote currency. Given 'BTC/USD', the quote is 'USD'

info.description: Raw market response gotten from the exchange site's API

lot.description: When placing an order, its amount must be divisible by this lot value

id.description: The unique identifier of the exchange for this trade

info.description: Raw trade response gotten from the exchange site's API

symbol.description: The currency pair of this trade

id.description: The unique identifier of the exchange for this order

symbol.description: The currency pair of this order

cost.description: The cost of this order (i.e. price x amount)

filled.description: The amount of this order that is currently filled (i.e. this can be less than or equal to 'amount')

remaining.description: The amount of this order that is still yet to be filled (i.e. this can be less than or equal to 'amount')

info.description: Raw order response gotten from the exchange site's API

Side.description: Wether this is a bid or ask (i.e. buy or sell) order

timestamp.description: The timestamp associated for this order book

datetime.description: The timestamp associated for this order book

OrderStatus.description: The current status of this order

OrderType.description: Whether this is a 'market' order or a 'limit' order

info.description: Raw balance response gotten from the exchange site's API

balances.description: List of balances per currency that you own

amount.description: The allowable precision of the amount when placing an order. For example, given 2, then an amount of 0.123 must be made either 0.12 (or 0.13)

price.description: The allowable precision of the amount when placing an order. For example, given 2, then a price of 0.123 must be made either 0.12 (or 0.13)

token.description: The JWT token that needs to be added into the 'Authorization' header with the 'Bearer ' prefix. For example, given a token of xyz, do a secured request with 'Authorization: Bearer xyz'

id.description: The id of the exchange. When you created the exchange (via POST:/exchanges/{exhangeName}), the 'id' parameter there becomes the name here

private.description: Whether this exchange is private (has apiKey) or public (no apiKey)

enableRateLimit.description: Whether to enable the built in rate limiter or not. The built in rate limiter is an approximation of the actual exchange's limit. To have a more accurate rate limiting, set this to false and implement the rate limiter on your client

countries.description: The list of countries where this exchange is a member of

rateLimit.description: A request rate limit in milliseconds. Specifies the required minimal delay between two consequent HTTP requests to the same exchange. If enableRateLimit is set to false, this would be ignored.

twofa.description: Whether to enable two factor authentication or not

urls.description: Collection of URLs this exchange has

symbol.description: The currency pair of this tick

high.description: The higest price of this tick

low.description: The lowest price of this tick

bid.description: The current bid price of this tick

ask.description: The current ask price of this tick

vwap.description: The volume weighted average price of this tick

close.description: The closing price of this tick

last.description: The last price of this tick

baseVolume.description: The volume of the base currency of this tick

quoteVolume.description: The volume of the quote currency of this tick

info.description: Raw ticker response gotten from the exchange site's API

id.description: The unique identifier for this exchange.

apiKey.description: The API key you got from the exchange itself. This with the secret is what will allow you to access the exchange

secret.description: The Secret key you got from the exchange itself. This with the apiKey is what will allow you to access the exchange

enableRateLimit.description: Whether to enable the built in rate limiter or not. The built in rate limiter is an approximation of the actual exchange's limit. To have a more accurate rate limiting, set this to false and implement the rate limiter on your client

symbol.description: The currency pair (base/quote) of the order to be created

amount.description: The amount of currency pair's base that we want to buy or sell

price.description: The buying price or the selling price in terms of the quote. Price is needed for market orders and ignored in limit orders

orderIdParam.name: orderId
orderIdParam.description: The id of the order. Possible values are any of the result of GET:/exchange/{exchangeName}/orders.

requiredExchangeSymbolParam.name: symbol
requiredExchangeSymbolParam.description: The symbol of the exchange's data to be retrieved. Possible values are any of symbols in GET:/exchange/{exchangeName}/markets

optionalExchangeSymbolParam.name: symbol
optionalExchangeSymbolParam.description: The symbol of the exchange's data to be retrieved. Possible values are any of symbols in GET:/exchange/{exchangeName}/markets

exchangeNameParam.name: exchangeName
exchangeNameParam.description: The name of the exchange. Possible values are any of the result of GET:/exchanges.

tags.name: Authentication API
tags.description:
APIs that manage [creation](/#createPrivateConnection) / [deletion](/#deletePrivateConnection) / [retrieving](/#getone) of exchange connections. 

Most [Public Data APIs](/#ccxt-rest-public-data-api) by most exchanges can be used without providing the API Key and Secret. 

For example, you get retrieve the market of binance by doing `GET:/exchange/binance/market` directly and would be able to get the markets of binance. 

But some exchanges though would require you to use an API Key and Secret even when accessing their Public Data API. For  example, for cointiger, if you want to retrieve its market and you do `GET:/exchange/cointiger/market`, you will a `403` error (_i.e. meaning you were unauthorized to access it_). Thus, to use that api of continger, you would first have to provide your API Key and Secret to continger via `POST:/exchange/continger -d {"id":"myCoinTiger","apiKey":"My-COINTIGER-KEY","secret":"s3cret"}`. From there, you will get a response `{"token":"xxx.yyy.zzz"}`. That `"xxx.yyy.zzz"` would then what you will use to connect to coiniger - i.e. `GET:/exchange/cointiger/market -H "Authorization: Bearer xxx.yyy.zzz"` and this time, your request will push  through and would be able to get cointiger's market.

Furthemore, all [Private Data APIs](/#ccxt-rest-private-data-api) of all exchanges would require API Key and Secret. Thus, although `GET:/exchange/binance/market` would work, doing `GET:/exchange/binance/balances` will not. You'd have to provide first binance your API Key and Secret like `POST:/exchange/binance -d {"id":"myBinance","apiKey":"binance-key","secret":"s3cret"}`, to get something like `{"token":"aaa.bbb.ccc"}`, which you can then use to execute  `GET:/exchange/binance/balances -H "Authorization: Bearer aaa.bbb.ccc"` which would finally get your balances.

tags.name: Public Data API
tags.description: APIs that retrieve public data (like ticker, order books, trades, etc)

tags.name: Private Data API
tags.description: APIs that retrieve private data (like your balances, your open orders, your closed orders, your trades, etc)

tags.name: Experimental API
tags.description: APIs that may be useful but are in experimental stage. Some of these APIs may potentially be removed in the future or be moved into one of the previous categories
